alert.note: Alert for Nassau; New York (Manhattan); Queens (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS New York City - Upton (Long Island and New York City)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 16 at 3:37AM EDT until August 16 at 6:45AM EDT by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 530 AM EDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of northeast New Jersey, including the following counties, Bergen and Hudson. Portions of southeast New York, including the following counties, Bronx, Nassau, New York (Manhattan) and Queens. * WHEN...Until 530 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 337 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. Overflowing poor drainage areas will cause minor flooding in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Flushing, Mott Haven, East Tremont, Hackensack, Glen Cove, Bergenfield, Paramus, Garden City, Lyndhurst, Rutherford, Secaucus, Ridgefield, Great Neck, RFK Bridge, Laguardia Airport, Throgs Neck Bridge, Midtown Manhattan, Harlem, Jackson Heights and Astoria. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
